name: ProtectionDevice
title: Protection Device
description: Protection Device codes for insurance operations.

concept.definition: A fire suppression system that automatically activates when heat is detected, releasing water through sprinkler heads to control or extinguish fires.
A device that monitors carbon monoxide gas levels in the air and sounds an alarm when dangerous concentrations are detected.
A fire suppression system where all sprinkler heads are open, and water is released simultaneously across the entire protected area when the system is activated.
A general-purpose sensing device that monitors environmental conditions or intrusions.

concept.display: Dual-type (ultrasonic & passive infrared and microwave & infrared) – Intrusion Detector
concept.definition: An intrusion detection device that combines multiple sensing technologies (ultrasonic, passive infrared, microwave, and infrared) to reduce false alarms and improve detection accuracy.

designation.value: Mixte (ultrasonique et infrarouge passif et micro-onde et infrarouge) - Détecteur d'intrusion
Tipo dual (ultrasónico e infrarrojo pasivo y microondas e infrarrojo) – Detector de intrusión

concept.definition: A fire detection device that responds to increases in ambient temperature or reaches a predetermined temperature threshold.
A security sensor consisting of two magnetic components that triggers an alarm when separated, typically used on doors and windows to detect opening.
A fire suppression system that requires manual activation to release water through sprinkler heads.
A security device that detects movement by emitting microwave energy and sensing changes in the reflected signal pattern.
A manually activated emergency device that immediately triggers an alarm to summon assistance.
A security device that detects intrusions by monitoring interruptions in a beam of light between a transmitter and receiver.
A general-purpose device that detects and responds to physical stimuli such as heat, light, sound, pressure, or motion.
A security device consisting of a tensioned wire that triggers an alarm when physical contact causes it to be disturbed or broken.
A security device that combines ultrasonic and infrared detection technologies to identify movement or intrusions.
Electrical wiring with enhanced insulation, shielding, or conduit protection to prevent damage from environmental factors, tampering, or fire.
A smoke detection device that uses a light source and photosensor to detect smoke particles by measuring light scattering or obscuration.
A smoke detection device that uses a small amount of radioactive material to ionize air and detect smoke particles by measuring changes in electrical current.
A device that senses smoke as an indicator of fire and sounds an alarm to warn occupants.
A portable device containing an extinguishing agent that can be manually discharged to suppress small fires.
A device that detects the movement of water through pipes in a sprinkler system and triggers an alarm when flow is detected.
A security sensor that detects the sound frequency or vibration of breaking glass to identify window or door breaches.
A motion sensor that detects changes in infrared radiation caused by moving warm bodies such as people or animals.
A device that senses the presence of water where it should not be and triggers an alarm to prevent water damage.
No protection device installed or applicable.
A protection device not categorized in the standard list.
A fire suppression system using agents other than water, such as foam, gas, or chemical compounds.
